Turing Award 1971

Winner: John McCarthy

In 1956, John McCarthy coined the term of "Artificial Intelligence" as "the science and engineering of making intelligent machines". McCarthy also created a wide used programming language called LISP, that was at least initially mainly used by the AI community due to its power and flexability. He received the A.M Turing Award in 1971 for his contributions to the newborn field of Artificial Intelligence.
